messages.content: As Shadow Schools Minister, Mike Kane has been fighting to protect our local schools. If the Conservatives win the election on the 8th June, they plan to cut the funding for schools across Wythenshawe & Sale East by around £8 million. That will mean fewer teachers, teaching assistants, books and resources. Our schools are suffering from over 100 Tory cuts - class sizes are soaring and the number of unqualified teachers is on the rise.

Tory plans will mean universities can push up tuition fees even further. Only Labour will create opportunity for all in Wythenshawe & Sale East. By reversing all Tory cuts to school budgets, class sizes and funding, Labour will ensure children enjoy smaller class sizes and more personal learning time. By abolishing tuition fees, bringing back the Education Maintenance Allowance and restore maintenance grants for students from low and middle income backgrounds.

Mike said: "Class sizes are under this Tory Government due to our schools bearing the brunt of the Conservatives cuts. Re-elect me and I'll stand up to protect our children and their schools to deliver a world class education."
Only Mike Kane will stand up for our NHS.

Labour's Mike Kane has pledged to stand up for our NHS services across Wythenshawe & Sale East if re-elected on the 8th June. Under the Tories, our NHS has been stretched to breaking point. Waiting lists in England have reached almost 3.8 million - the highest on record. And our NHS is being broken up through privatisation. The Tories are running our health service into the ground. Only Labour will stand up for our NHS

The Tories plan to cut Winter Fuel Payments, leaving over 13 thousand people in Wythenshawe & Sale East without the extra money they need to heat their homes in the winter. The Tories would also scrap the Triple Lock on state pensions, which means your pension may not keep up with the cost of living. Under the Tories, the State Pension Age will be raised to 66, and free TV licences for over 3.4 million pensioners will be scrapped. Only Labour will stand up for pensioners and protect Labour will protect pensioner incomes by insuring your pension will rise each year by whichever is highest: average earnings, inflation, or 2.5 per cent.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: By reversing all Tory cuts to school budgets, class sizes and funding, Labour will ensure children enjoy smaller class sizes and more personal learning time. By abolishing tuition fees, bringing back the Education Maintenance Allowance and restore maintenance grants for students from low and middle income backgrounds.
Stand up for our NHS services across Wythenshawe & Sale East, tackle the longest waiting lists in England, and stop the privatisation of the health service.

Prevent the Tory plans to cut Winter Fuel Payments and scrap the Triple Lock on state pensions, protect pensioner incomes by insuring your pension will rise each year by whichever is highest: average earnings, inflation, or 2.5 per cent.
